patterns: How does the final project work?
responses: The Final Year Project is mandatory. You’ll work in a group to solve a real-world problem.
Your project must be supervised, documented, and presented. Ask your advisor or check the bulletin!
Internships are done in the 3rd year. You must apply, work for 2 months, and submit a report.
Ask the internship coordinator or check the latest bulletin for partner companies.

patterns: What job can I get after this?
responses: Graduates work as software developers, data analysts, UX designers, IT consultants, and more.
The IS degree opens paths in tech, business, and research — let’s explore it together!
Check with the Dean’s Office or Student Affairs for active scholarship and support programs.
Some scholarships are merit-based, others need-based — apply early!
Talk to your instructor or academic advisor immediately. They’ll help you find the right support.
There are peer-tutoring programs and study sessions for most core courses.

patterns: Where can I get old exams?
responses: Download all course files, notes, and exams from our Telegram bot 👉 @SISResourcesBot
For files, head to @SISResourcesBot. I handle info, not file sharing. 📁
Sewasew made the ISSeer not the bot!

patterns: The Classmate I could not figure out
responses: Eden is the most talented IS Student. She works hard, she is competent, she is funny and also She is the best that IS could offer.

patterns: How do I register for classes?
How do I fix registration issues?
responses: You can register on the AAU Student Information System (SIS Portal). Need a direct link?
For help with registration errors, visit the SIS admin office near Lab 1.
The department usually posts the exam schedule on the SIS hallway board and Telegram. Want me to check?
I can share links to the latest exam calendar if you tell me the semester.

patterns: Do I need OOP before AI?
responses: SIS courses usually follow a set structure. I can help you check the prerequisites based on the curriculum flowchart.
Let me know the course name and I’ll check if there’s a required class before it.
You’ll need to complete around 145 ECTS including core, electives, and internship.
Ask me about your batch year and I’ll break down the credit requirements!

patterns: Where can I apply for internships?
Can I get help finding internship sites?
responses: Yes! Internships are part of your 3rd-year curriculum. You’ll need departmental approval.
I can suggest companies and NGO partners that accept SIS students. Want the list?
I’m TheISSeer — your department helper bot!
I help you explore the IS department, courses, events, student activities, and much more at AAU!

🏆 Team Roha consists of IS students Berhanelidet, Edeal, Abel, Shahon, and CS student Nolawi. They earned 2nd place at the Google Developer Student Clubs AAU Hackathon. Their teamwork and innovation were outstanding!

patterns: Tell me about the IS_Talks show
responses: 🎤 IS_Talks is a student-led talk series from the School of Information Systems, spotlighting tech innovators and student projects. Watch one of our best episodes featuring Team Roha here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=DedNu9pTV3E&t=3187s

💡 IS students are tech-savvy and business-minded. They’re into coding, design, entrepreneurship, and data. Whether they’re participating in hackathons, GDSC AAU, or launching startups, they balance technical skills with creative and managerial thinking.

📍 IS at AAU uniquely blends tech and business. While CS focuses more on algorithms and hardcore programming, IS prepares you for roles like system analyst, tech consultant, or digital strategist by combining coding with business, data, and user-centered design thinking.

patterns: What does the IS program teach?
responses:
🗂️ The BIS program is structured over 4 years:
1️⃣ Foundational courses: C++, Math, Emerging Tech.
2️⃣ Core management & database subjects.
3️⃣ System analysis, web dev, and networking.
4️⃣ Advanced: AI, HCI, Project Management, Enterprise Systems. 
📌 For full course catalog, ask me!

patterns: Tell me about the IS department
Where is the IS department located?
responses:
👋 Welcome to the School of Information Systems at AAU! 
We offer a dynamic 4-year Bachelor’s in Information Systems (BIS), blending tech and management skills. Located on the FBE Campus, our department provides a balanced curriculum covering programming, cybersecurity, systems design, and more. Contact us at 011 122 9191 or visit the 1st floor of the Eshetu Chole Building.

patterns: What do we learn in this course?
responses: This course covers various aspects of Information Science, including data management, systems design, and user experience.
The instructor for this course is Dr. Michael Melese, an expert in Information Science.

patterns: What is the Information Science department?
Give me information about your department
What do you study in this department?
responses: The Information Science department focuses on data, systems, and technologies that connect people and knowledge.

patterns: What is the mission of the department?
What does the department aim to achieve?
responses: The mission of the Information Science department is to educate and train professionals in the field of information management.

patterns: What is the vision of the department?
What does the department aspire to be?
responses: The vision of the Information Science department is to be a leader in information education and research in Africa.
We offer undergraduate and graduate programs in Information Science, including BSc and MSc degrees.

patterns: List of courses in Information Science
Which classes are part of this department?
responses: We offer courses like Data Science, Web Development, Databases, Human-Computer Interaction, and more.

patterns: How can I contact the department?
responses: You can reach us at: @TheISSeer or @Berhanbek on social media.

responses: The best person, the best Doctor, the best sister. Nobody is like her!
